isis.stitle: Procedural Guideline - OIL PAN AND/OR GASKET (V-8), REPLACE

step1.para: Chock wheels.
Open hood.
Drain radiator and remove coolant filter.

note.para: Step 4 applies to vehicles with engines built after 10/3/94.

step1.para: Remove coolant surge tank hose mount bracket at radiator frame.
Remove oil dipstick tube.
Remove charge air pipe from radiator frame (left side).
Remove fan blade from clutch, and slide on shaft toward front of engine.
Under chassis, remove front engine mount to crossmember nut.
Remove (4) bolts and nuts from the left and right side frame rails (2 at top of frame rail flange and 2 at bottom of frame rail flange), securing front engine mount crossmember brackets.

note.para: If vehicle is equipped with air brakes, the air compressor and bracket must be removed for access to one of the left side crossmember bracket bolts.

step1.para: Install overhead lifting device to lift eye at front top of engine.
Remove front engine mount bolts from block and position the mount forward approx. 1.5 inches.
Using hammer, drive engine mount crossmember forward approximately 1 inch for oil pan access.
Drain engine oil.
Remove oil filter.
Remove oil pan bolts.
Remove oil pan, using special tool to cut sealant material, along with pry bars to break pan loose from mating surface.
Remove oil pan from under chassis.

note.para: Depending on front axle/spring application, it may be necessary to increase the distance between the frame rails and the axle in order to remove the pan. Position a hydraulic floor jack and block of wood under the radiator crossmember and raise the chassis approximately 3 to 4 inches.

step1.para: Thoroughly clean oil pan and engine block mating surfaces, using special cleaner.

note.para: It is very important that all of the original sealant is removed and that the pan, block, and rear plate mating surfaces are clean and dry before resealing.

step1.para: Straighten oil pan lip.
Before applying sealant, position the oil pan under the chassis to establish proper routing of the pan to block mating surfaces.
Apply sealant to lip of oil pan. Apply a slightly heavier than normal bead of sealant in the valleys on the ends of the pan.
Position oil pan to engine block mating surface, taking care not to rub off any of the sealant.
Install oil pan bolts and torque bolts in sequence to spec.
Position engine crossmember bracket fasteners and secure crossmember to frame rails.
Position front engine mount and secure to engine block and torque to spec.
Remove engine lifting device.
Install front engine mount to crossmember nut, and torque to spec.
Install fan blade to clutch, and torque to spec.
Install charge air pipe to radiator frame.
Install oil filter.
Install oil dipstick tube.
Fill engine oil.
Install coolant surge tank hose mount bracket at radiator frame.
Install coolant filter.
Fill coolant system.
Start engine, run to normal operating temperature, and check for leaks.
Close hood.
Remove wheel chocks.
